definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: They make great holiday and birthday gifts.
sentences.chinese: 这些书实在是不可多得的节日和生日礼物。

sentences.english: The new guy  is a treasure in the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是该队不可多得的新队员。

sentences.english: Also, they are inaccessible data for the study of historical periods from the end of Han Dynasty to Wei and Jin Dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 也是研究汉末至魏晋这一历史时期不可多得的材料。

sentences.english: Rodin's Old Streetwalker is a rare work in statuary history.
sentences.chinese: 罗丹的《老娼妓》是雕塑史上一件不可多得的杰作。

sentences.english: He is a person of rare talent. You must put him in a very important position.
sentences.chinese: 他是不可多得的梁木，你一定要好好重用他。

sentences.english: This article is clear in its theme, and logical in its structure.
sentences.chinese: 篇文章文理显豁，主题清楚，是篇不可多得的佳作。

sentences.english: "Rare" means precious and rare people who used an analogy with holiness.
sentences.chinese: 凤毛麟角“指珍贵而不可多得用来比喻有圣德的人。
这是一本不可多得的珍本。

sentences.english: Participate outside the classroom is an invaluable opportunity to make the classroom language active.
sentences.chinese: 课外练习是不可多得的活用课上语言的机会。

sentences.english: He is a new member in god-given.
sentences.chinese: 他是该队不可多得的新队员。

sentences.english: He is the best new teamer.
sentences.chinese: 他是该队不可多得的新队员。

definition: can be rated as/can be said to be
can be discovered but not sought (idiom)/one can only come across such things serendipitously
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
